revised_title: The Royal Society's Relationship with Italian Science from 1667 to 1795
tldr: This article explores the relationship between the Royal Society and Italian science from 1667 to 1795. It highlights the admiration and respect English scientists had for their Italian counterparts, as well as the exchange of ideas and collaboration between the two communities. The article also discusses the challenges of communication and the role of key individuals in fostering connections between the Royal Society and Italian scientists.
